title: Log in to the suite
content:
The Service Management Automation suite has the following user interfaces for different user roles: suite administrators, IT agents, and self-service users. These interfaces use different URLs, as described in the following table.

Note If you use SAML authentication and you want to do Single Sign On (SSO) between Service Management and other applications in your organization, you can append the "AUTH=SAML" parameter to the Service Management URL: https://<EXTERNAL_ACCESS_HOST>/saw/ess?TENANTID=xxxxxxxxx&AUTH=SAML. Then, you are redirected to your corporate IdP and you don't need to enter your user name and password for Service Management if you are already logged in.
User interface Login URL Log in as
Suite Administration https://<EXTERNAL_ACCESS_HOST>/bo Suite administration users

The out-of-tbox suite administration user is suite-admin, who can create more suite administration users in the Suite Administration interface.
Suite Administration https://<EXTERNAL_ACCESS_HOST>/bo?ACCOUNTID=xxxxxxxxx Shared service admin or shared service agent users
IdM Admin Portal https://<External_Access_Host>/idm-admin Suite administration users

The out-of-box suite administration user is suite-admin.

Notes:

  • Only use the IdM Admin Portal to perform the tasks indicated in the documents such as configuring user authorization for DND, adding authentication configurations, and configuring password policies. Do not use the IdM Admin Portal to perform other operations such as user creation, configuring the lightweight SSO settings, configuring the IdM signing key, and so on; you must configure these settings in Suite Administration instead.
  • For SSO, IdM Admin Portal supports login in this release. However, consistent logout and session timeout behaviors aren't supported between IdM and other suite applications.

Service Management /Cloud Management

 https://<EXTERNAL_ACCESS_HOST>/dashboard?TENANTID=xxxxxxxxx

IT agents

Note:

  • If a user is entitled to multiple tenants and the user has logged in to one tenant, the user needs to open another browser session or log out from the current tenant to access a different tenant.
  • When an IT agent stays in the "Design" and "Deployment Operations" modules for a long time, the system might require a relogin if the IT agent goes to other modules.
Service Portal https://<EXTERNAL_ACCESS_HOST>/saw/ess?TENANTID=xxxxxxxxx

Self-service (ESS) users

Notes:

  • If a user is entitled to multiple tenants and the user has logged in to one tenant, the user needs to open another browser session or log out from the current tenant to access a different tenant.
  • For a user with the Agent role: after the user is logged out because of a session timeout or a click on the logout button, after relogin, the user is directed to the Service Portal page where the user left. 
Managed Service Management tenant https://<EXTERNAL_ACCESS_HOST>/dashboard?TENANTID=xxxxxxxxxSHARED=TRUE Shared service users
Mobile app Log in from an Android or iOS mobile device. For details, see Service Portal mobile app. IT agents or ESS users
